content.raw: Hopefully teams have all sort of tools developed to control the robot. We only have access to the Gazebo tools and we're following the opposite approach: Trying to move the tip of the cable by applying forces and stepping the simulation :)
content.html: Hopefully teams have all sort of tools developed to control the robot. We only have access to the Gazebo tools and we're following the opposite approach: Trying to move the tip of the cable by applying forces and stepping the simulation :)

content.raw:
Way to encourage us, guys. If you can't...

<adding to list of checkpoint skips>
content.html:
Way to encourage us, guys. If you can't...

<adding to list of checkpoint skips>

update.description:
This builds on top of pull request #44

Use the touch plugin to check when the robot has been the only thing touching the cable's tip (its last link) continuously for 0.5 seconds.

## How to test

1. Skip to 2/4:

        rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 2 4

1. The robot will be teleported to face the array and you'll see this message:

        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Started (30 293000000)
        success: True
        [Msg] Started touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]

1. Now… figure out a way to pick up the cable and verify it works :) I test this with a combination of @scpeters 's [grasping controller](https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping) and using the [Force/Torque dialog](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=apply_force_torque) to push the cable towards Val's hand.

    (i.e. Pause the world, apply between 100 ~ 400 N in the desired direction, step the world a few times to see how the cable is moving, then apply force again… Until the cable is inside the hand. Make the hand close, then step more and adjust the cable as needed. Not elegant, I know…)

1. While the grasping is halfway there and choppy, your terminal will be spammed like:

        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 268000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 303000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 325000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 346000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 357000000 seconds
        …

1. Then finally you get a good grip:

    ![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2661890985-t2cp4.png)

1. Wait ~~5~~ 0.5 seconds, and the checkpoint is complete:

        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 675000000 seconds
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] touched [valkyrie] exclusively for 0 500000000 seconds
        [Msg] Stopped touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Completed (50 677000000)
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Started (50 677000000)

‌

‌
update.title: Task 2 Checkpoint 4

content.raw:
Yeah I know, right? I heard they're offering a prize for it ;)

I managed to use the snake-charming technique to bring the cable to the hand, but that's a lot of work... This also motivated me to revive some [code](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhUd4JbY-8Q) for graphical manipulation of links @hsu wrote a couple years ago when I have some time :)
content.html:
Yeah I know, right? I heard they're offering a prize for it ;)

I managed to use the snake-charming technique to bring the cable to the hand, but that's a lot of work... This also motivated me to revive some code for graphical manipulation of links @hsu wrote a couple years ago when I have some time :)

content.raw: This is really hard! :) I didn't manage to grab, so I cannot verify that the checkpoint is complete.
content.html: This is really hard! :) I didn't manage to grab, so I cannot verify that the checkpoint is complete.

update.description:
This builds on top of pull request #44

Use the touch plugin to check when the robot has been the only thing touching the cable's tip (its last link) continuously for 0.5 seconds.

## How to test

1. Skip to 2/4:

        rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 2 4

1. The robot will be teleported to face the array and you'll see this message:

        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Started (30 293000000)
        success: True
        [Msg] Started touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]

1. Now… figure out a way to pick up the cable and verify it works :) I test this with a combination of @scpeters 's [grasping controller](https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping) and using the [Force/Torque dialog](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=apply_force_torque) to push the cable towards Val's hand.

    (i.e. Pause the world, apply between 100 ~ 400 N in the desired direction, step the world a few times to see how the cable is moving, then apply force again… Until the cable is inside the hand. Make the hand close, then step more and adjust the cable as needed. Not elegant, I know…)

1. While the grasping is halfway there and choppy, your terminal will be spammed like:

        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 268000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 303000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 325000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 346000000 seconds
        [Msg] Not touching anything
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 357000000 seconds
        …

1. Then finally you get a good grip:

    ![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2661890985-t2cp4.png)

1. Wait ~~5~~ 0.5 seconds, and the checkpoint is complete:

        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 675000000 seconds
        [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] touched [valkyrie] exclusively for 0 500000000 seconds
        [Msg] Stopped touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Completed (50 677000000)
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Started (50 677000000)

‌

‌

    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 357000000 seconds
    …

Then finally you get a good grip:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2661890985-t2cp4.png)

Wait 5 seconds, and the checkpoint is complete:

    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 675000000 seconds
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] touched [valkyrie] exclusively for 5 0 seconds
    [Msg] Stopped touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Completed (50 677000000)
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Started (50 677000000)

‌

‌
update.title: Task 2 Checkpoint 4

update.description:
This builds on top of pull request #44

Use the touch plugin to check when the robot has been the only thing touching the cable's tip (its last link) continuously for 5 seconds.

## How to test

Skip to 2/3 (as of now, this will change as pull requests are merged):

`rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 2 3`

The robot will be teleported to face the array and you'll see this message:

    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [3] - Started (30 293000000)
    success: True
    [Msg] Started touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]

Now… figure out a way to pick up the cable and verify it works :) I test this with a combination of @scpeters 's [grasping controller](https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping) and using the [Force/Torque dialog](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=apply_force_torque) to push the cable towards Val's hand.

\(i.e. Pause the world, apply between 100 ~ 400 N in the desired direction, step the world a few times to see how the cable is moving, then apply force again… Until the cable is inside the hand. Make the hand close, then step more and adjust the cable as needed. Not elegant, I know…)

While the grasping is halfway there and choppy, your terminal will be spammed like:

    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 268000000 seconds
    [Msg] Not touching anything
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 303000000 seconds
    [Msg] Not touching anything
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 325000000 seconds
    [Msg] Not touching anything
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 346000000 seconds
    [Msg] Not touching anything
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 357000000 seconds
    …

Then finally you get a good grip:

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2661890985-t2cp4.png)

Wait 5 seconds, and the checkpoint is complete:

    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] started touching [valkyrie] at 45 675000000 seconds
    [Msg] Model [solar_panel_cable] touched [valkyrie] exclusively for 5 0 seconds
    [Msg] Stopped touch plugin [task2/checkpoint4]
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [4] - Completed (50 677000000)
    [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [5] - Started (50 677000000)

‌

‌
